column4: how do i transfer files from my pc (ubuntu 7.10) to my new macbook?
you've installed openssh-server on the ubuntu machine?
not sure, but I have connected pc to pc via ssh
if you've ssh'd to it before then you have it
not sure why my password is not being accepted when I ssh from the mac.  When I go to terminal and sudo or root, password is accepted.
does this work on the ubuntu machine: ssh localhost
ok so it seems the problem is definitely local to the ubuntu machine
how to fix?  when i type ssh localhost on the mac, connection refused also.  the mac connects to the pc, just won't accept password
have you edited /etd/ssh/ssh_config or added a ~/.ssh/config ?
no and don't know what to add
it should work with no changes, and you did say it worked before
and you can't ssh from the desktop pc to itself?
ssh: connect to host localost port 22: Connection refused
oh.. have you messed with iptables or firestarter or otherwise added firewall rules ?
